00019 /** \file
00020  \brief Generate socket data
00021 */
00022 
00023 #include <stdlib.h>
00024 #include <stdio.h>
00025 #include <string.h>
00026 #include <unistd.h>
00027 
00028 #include <sys/types.h>
00029 #include <sys/socket.h>
00030 #include <netdb.h>
00031 
00032 #include "datasource.h"
00033 
00034 struct socket_gen {
00035     int handle; // Actual handle
00036 };
00037 
00038 // Do a command
00039 /** \param cmd the command to send
00040    \param ret shove the returned stuff in this
00041    \param n allocated size of ret
00042    \return number of bytes copied into ret, or -1 on failure
00043 */
00044 static int gen_dosockcmd(struct socket_gen *g, const char *cmd, char *ret, int n);
00045 
00046 const char *socket_simgen_name() {
00047     return "Socket";
00048 }
00049 
00050 const char *socket_simgen_longdesc() {
00051     return "Connect to a wifi/network OBDII device\n"
00052         "Seed: <host:port>";
00053 }
00054 
00055 int socket_simgen_create(void **gen, const char *seed) {
00056     if(NULL == seed || '\0' == *seed) {
00057         fprintf(stderr, "Must pass \"ip-or-hostname:port\" as the seed\n");
00058         return 1;
00059     }
00060 
00061     struct socket_gen *g = malloc(sizeof(struct socket_gen));
00062     if(NULL == g) {
00063         fprintf(stderr, "Couldn't allocate memory for socket generator\n");
00064         return 1;
00065     }
00066 
00067     // Parse the seed
00068     char *seedcopy = strdup(seed); // Because strtok needs non-const.
00069 
00070     char *node;
00071     node = strtok(seedcopy, ": "); // Allow them to separate with a space
00072     char *service;
00073     service = strtok(NULL, ": ");
00074 
00075 
00076     // Actually get the address for connecting
00077     struct addrinfo hints;
00078     hints.ai_family = AF_INET;
00079     hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
00080     hints.ai_protocol = IPPROTO_TCP;
00081     hints.ai_flags = (AI_V4MAPPED | AI_ADDRCONFIG);
00082     hints.ai_canonname = NULL;
00083     hints.ai_addr = NULL;
00084     hints.ai_next = NULL;
00085 
00086     struct addrinfo *res; // From getaddrinfo
00087 
00088     if(0 != getaddrinfo(node, service, &hints, &res)) {
00089         perror("getaddrinfo error");
00090         free(seedcopy);
00091         free(g);
00092         return 1;
00093     }
00094 
00095     // Done with those for now. node and service are now invalid
00096     free(seedcopy);
00097 
00098     if(NULL == res) {
00099         fprintf(stderr, "getaddrinfo didn't return anything for \"%s\"\n", seed);
00100         free(g);
00101         return 1;
00102     }
00103 
00104     // Create the socket
00105     if(0 > (g->handle = socket(res->ai_family, res->ai_socktype, res->ai_protocol))) {
00106         perror("Couldn't create socket");
00107         freeaddrinfo(res);
00108         free(g);
00109         return 1;
00110     }
00111 
00112     // Attempt to connect
00113     if(0 > connect(g->handle, res->ai_addr, res->ai_addrlen)) {
00114         perror("Couldn't connect to host");
00115         freeaddrinfo(res);
00116         free(g);
00117         return 1;
00118     }
00119 
00120     // Don't need this anymore
00121     freeaddrinfo(res);
00122 
00123     // Should be connected if we're here. Do some commands
00124 
00125     char atretvalue[1024];
00126 
00127     if(-1 == gen_dosockcmd(g, "ATZ\n", atretvalue, sizeof(atretvalue))) {
00128         close(g->handle);
00129         free(g);
00130         return -1;
00131     }
00132 
00133     if(-1 == gen_dosockcmd(g, "ATE0\n", atretvalue, sizeof(atretvalue))) {
00134         close(g->handle);
00135         free(g);
00136         return -1;
00137     }
00138 
00139     if(-1 == gen_dosockcmd(g, "ATS0\n", atretvalue, sizeof(atretvalue))) {
00140         close(g->handle);
00141         free(g);
00142         return -1;
00143     }
00144 
00145     *gen = g;
00146     return 0;
00147 }
00148 
00149 void socket_simgen_destroy(void *gen) {
00150     struct socket_gen *g = gen;
00151     if(-1 == close(g->handle)) {
00152         perror("Error closing socket");
00153     }
00154     free(gen);
00155 }
00156 
00157 int socket_simgen_getvalue(void *gen, unsigned int mode, unsigned int PID, unsigned int *A, unsigned int *B, unsigned int *C, unsigned int *D) {
00158     char cmd[32];
00159     snprintf(cmd, sizeof(cmd), "%02X %02X\n", mode, PID);
00160 
00161     char retbuf[1024];
00162     if(-1 == gen_dosockcmd((struct socket_gen *)gen, cmd, retbuf, sizeof(retbuf))) {
00163         return -1;
00164     }
00165 
00166     unsigned int response;
00167     unsigned int retmode;
00168     int count = sscanf(retbuf, "%2x %2x %2x %2x %2x %2x", &response, &retmode,
00169             A,B,C,D);
00170 
00171     return (count<2?0:count-2);
00172 }
00173 
00174 int socket_simgen_idle(void *gen, int idlems) {
00175     return 0;
00176 }
00177 
00178 // Declare our obdsim_generator. This is pulled in as an extern in obdsim.c
00179 struct obdsim_generator obdsimgen_socket = {
00180     socket_simgen_name,
00181     socket_simgen_longdesc,
00182     socket_simgen_create,
00183     socket_simgen_destroy,
00184     socket_simgen_getvalue,
00185     socket_simgen_idle,
00186     NULL,
00187     NULL
00188 };
00189 
00190 static int gen_dosockcmd(struct socket_gen *g, const char *cmd, char *ret, int n) {
00191     printf("Sending \"%s\" to network socket\n", cmd);
00192 
00193     if(write(g->handle, cmd, strlen(cmd)) != strlen(cmd)) {
00194         perror("Couldn't write to network socket");
00195         return -1;
00196     }
00197 
00198     memset(ret, '\0', n);
00199 
00200     int done = 0;
00201     int totalread = 0;
00202     char *curr_ret = ret;
00203     while(!done && totalread < n) {
00204         int nread = read(g->handle, curr_ret, n-totalread);
00205         if(-1 == nread) {
00206             perror("Network read error");
00207             return -1;
00208         }
00209         totalread += nread;
00210         if(NULL != strstr(ret, ">")) {
00211             done = 1;
00212         }
00213     }
00214 
00215     printf("Socket returned: \"%s\"\n", ret);
00216 
00217     return totalread;
00218 }
